meanings.definition: A smaller scale within a larger scale, used for measuring specific aspects of a larger concept.
meanings.sent1: The subscales on the thermometer help us measure different temperatures accurately.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used subscales to measure various factors affecting students' academic performance.
meanings.sent3: The subscales on the ruler decided to have a competition to see who could measure the longest distance.
meanings.sent4: In the orchestra, each instrument played a different note, creating a beautiful symphony of subscales.
meanings.sent5: The subscales of the map highlighted specific landmarks for easy navigation.

meanings.definition: Divisions or sections of a larger scale that measure different components.
meanings.sent1: The subscales of the recipe book helped organize different types of dishes.
meanings.sent2: The subscales of the color wheel represent various hues and shades.
meanings.sent3: The subscales at the party each had a different dance move, making the event lively.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like subscales of a spectrum, each one distinct and vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The subscales of the music sheet indicated the different musical notes to be played.
